intro: Calamintha vulgaris, commonly known as caraway, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes other aromatic herbs like parsley and dill. The plant features slender, branched stems and small white or pale pink flowers that bloom in umbels. Its leaves are finely divided and have a distinct, aromatic scent. The seeds, often referred to as caraway seeds, are widely used in culinary and medicinal applications.
